result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby Sanders Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program (AFTER 5 years of Initial Confinement).
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program (AFTER 5 years of Initial Confinement).
Apply 210 days sentence credit.

AS OF 4/02/2016: Credit DENIED as it would be duplicative as contrary to intent of sentence.
Consecutive to: Any other case.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution is ordered in the amount of $2,983 payable to Guaranty Bank.  To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision BEFORE costs/fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Guaranty Bank or any of the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
No possession of body armour.

Defendant Bobby Sanders in court, in custody, with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.   The Court strikes the repeater and the Court finds defendant guilty.  The Court orders a presentence investigation report be prepared and filed with the court in 30 days.  The Court to prepare and OTP from Green Bay Correctional Institution.  The Defendant is to arrive at the Waukesha County Jail on February 15, 2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bobby Sanders in court, in custody, with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  City of Brookfield Detective Michael Skemp sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Boese.  Cross examination by Attorney Rypel.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Attorney Rypel moves to dismiss.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.
